title: Steve Irwin's niece Rebecca Lobie flaunts ample cleavage and pert derriere in a G-string bikini
text:
She's the jaw-dropping niece of the late 'Crocodile Hunter' Steve Irwin, who has become an Instagram sensation.

And once again, Rebecca Lobie, 32, put on an eye-popping display when she stripped down into a G-string bikini at the beach.

Taking to Instagram on Thursday, the blonde bombshell shared a snap of herself flaunting her ample cleavage and pert derriere, amid reports of a bitter feud between Steve's widow Terri and his elderly father Bob over the direction of Australia Zoo.

An eye-popping display! Steve Irwin's niece Rebecca Lobie flaunted her ample cleavage and pert derriere as she stripped off into a G-string bikini at the beach... as the family is torn apart by feud over Australia Zoo

In the sultry snap, which appeared to be a throwback, Rebecca gave a flirty glare to the camera as she posed in a tiny blue bikini.

Rebecca tied her hair into a loose ponytail for the casual beach day and wore lashings of black mascara to accentuate her striking eyes.

She added a hint of glamour to her summer look by wearing an 'R' necklace around her neck, and crossed her legs in the air behind her as she enjoyed her day of relaxation.

She hinted the snap was a throwback, writing: 'Take me back to the weekend.'

Family ties: Rebecca is the niece of the late 'Crocodile Hunter' Steve Irwin (pictured in 2002). Rebecca's mother, Joy Muscillo, is Steve's sister

'Another absolutely incredible morning starter,' one fan wrote, while another added: 'Absolutely gorgeous and picture perfect!'

According to her LinkedIn account, Rebecca left her job as managing director of the Irwin's Australia Zoo in December 2015.

During her tenure, she oversaw 'multiple food outlets' at the Sunshine Coast tourist attraction, as well as 'catering and functions'.

In 2016, the Courier Mail reported that Rebecca, who is now working as a restaurant manager near her home in Mooloolaba, had cut all ties with Australia Zoo.

Putting it behind her: According to her LinkedIn account, Rebecca left her job as managing director of the Irwin's Australia Zoo in December 2015

Moving on: In 2016, the Courier Mail reported that Rebecca, who is now working as a restaurant manager near her home in Mooloolaba, had cut all ties with Australia Zoo

Around this time, her father Frank Muscillo - who is married to Steve Irwin's sister Joy - was 'marched off the premises' after a disagreement with Terri.

The Muscillo family, including Joy and Rebecca's brother James, are believed to have no involvement whatsoever in the company today.

Last month, Rebecca's mother Joy Muscillo - Steve's sister - spoke to Daily Mail Australia outside of her father Bob Irwin Snr's secluded property at Kingaroy in southern Queensland.

She described the family feud, which began after Steve's tragic death from a stingray barb in September 2006, as a 'very sad' situation.

Family ties: Last month, Rebecca's mother Joy Muscillo - Steve's sister - spoke to Daily Mail Australia outside of her father Bob Irwin Snr's secluded property at Kingaroy in southern Queensland. She described the family feud as a 'very sad' situation

Pictured: Rebecca's parents Joy Muscillo, who is the late Steve's sister, and Frank Muscillo

'I keep away from all that,' she said. 'It's just very sad... family stuff.'

Joy, who runs a restaurant with her husband, now leads a quiet life a world away from the glitz and glamour of her sister-in-law Terri, niece Bindi and nephew Bob Jnr.

After leaving Australia Zoo, Joy said she was bound to a confidentiality agreement that prevented her from speaking about what had happened.

While the agreement has since expired, she says it remains a 'personal decision' to keep her family dramas private.

Red hot! Rebecca has become an Instagram sensation

It comes after Bob Irwin Snr recently spoke the Courier Mail about the family feud that has left him estranged from his granddaughter Bindi.

Bob Snr left Australia Zoo in 2008, after he and daughter-in-law Terri reportedly feuded over the direction of the business in the wake of Steve's death.

He has not spoken to Terri, Bindi or Bob Jnr since.

When Bindi became engaged to her longtime boyfriend Chandler Powell in July, he revealed he had not yet been invited to the wedding and did not expect to be.

Despite this, he wished Bindi and Chandler 'all the best' and said he hopes their marriage goes 'really, really well'.
